title: SRAS shift right drops unemployment and inflation

content.question: Suppose that, from 1985 to 1986, unemployment fell from 7.2 to 7.0 percent and inflation fell from 3.8 to 1.1 percent. An explanation of these changes might be that the

choices.label: aggregate demand curve shifted to the left
aggregate demand curve shifted to the right
aggregate supply curve shifted to the left
aggregate supply curve shifted to the right
short-run Phillips curve shifted to the right

content.answer: aggregate supply curve shifted to the right

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
